p: The translated env aa sequences (FJo, Figure 3; data from all animals can be obtained from THV) demonstrate significant V1V2 heterogeneity, including heterogeneity in numerous predicted N-glyc sites (NXS/T, where X can be any aa but proline). Considerable V1 length variations were observed (Table 2 and for example, Figure 3), such that alignment of this region required manual adjustment, and may not represent precise homology. There were no trends in V1V2 sequence length variation over time (data not shown). Gag aa alignments (available from THV) showed significantly less aa variation reflecting its highly conserved nature.
